pull.title: doc: Document -checklevel levels
pull.body: Document the various possible check levels for the command-line argument. The numbers say nothing on their own.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
doc: Document -checklevel levels

Document the various possible check levels for the command-line
argument. The numbers say nothing on their own.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -426,7 +426,14 @@ void SetupServerArgs()
 #endif
 
     gArgs.AddArg("-checkblocks=<n>", strprintf("How many blocks to check at startup (default: %u, 0 = all)", DEFAULT_CHECKBLOCKS), true, OptionsCategory::DEBUG_TEST);
-    gArgs.AddArg("-checklevel=<n>", strprintf("How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is (0-4, default: %u)", DEFAULT_CHECKLEVEL), true, OptionsCategory::DEBUG_TEST);
+    gArgs.AddArg("-checklevel=<n>", strprintf("How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is: "
+        "level 0 reads the blocks from disk, "
+        "level 1 verifies block validity, "
+        "level 2 verifies undo data, "
+        "level 3 checks disconnection of tip blocks, "
+        "and level 4 tries to reconnect the blocks, "
+        "each level includes the checks of the previous levels"
comments.body: Did you intend for there to be a space between "levels" and "(0-4,"?
